1.speaker: PANDA
1.japanese: ねぇ　シロクマくん

5.speaker: POLAR BEAR
5.english: Like when I'm able to make something like this. It's a polar bear.

6.speaker: PANDA
6.japanese: ねぇ　どうやったの？

10.speaker: PANDA
10.japanese: 写真？　カメラ持ってるんだ？
10.english: A picture? You have a camera?

11.speaker: PENGUIN
11.english: Not a camera, exactly. I bought a sumafo (smartphone).

12.speaker: PANDA
12.japanese: なに？　スマフォって
12.english: What's a sumafo? That would be you rolled up in a reed mat {\i1}(sumaki){\i0}.

13.speaker: PENGUIN
13.english: Those are rice dumplings wrapped in bamboo leaves {\i1}(chimaki){\i0}.

18.speaker: PENGUIN
18.japanese: スマフォだよ！　ス　マ　フォ！(-_-;)
18.english: I said sumafo! As in smartphone! A sumafo, it's a kind of cell phone.

19.speaker: SASAKO
19.japanese: あっ！　ペンギンさん それが　スマートフォンですか？
19.english: Oh, Mr. Penguin, is that one of those sumafos?

20.speaker: SASAKO
20.japanese: 私も　よく知らないんですよね
20.english: I don't know much about them either.

22.speaker: SASAKO
22.english: What can it do? It's really convenient. There are lots of apps too.

23.speaker: LLAMA
23.japanese: 地図とかも見られますしね
23.english: And you can look up maps and such.

24.speaker: PENGUIN
24.japanese: ネットだって見られるんだよ　ほら
24.english: You can browse the Internet too! See?

25.speaker: SASAKO
25.japanese: なんか　小さくて 字　読みづらくないですか？
25.english: Aren't the words rather small and hard to read? Not at all! That's when you do this.

26.speaker: PENGUIN
26.japanese: パンチ操作って言ってね

28.speaker: LLAMA
28.japanese: ピンチ操作じゃないですか？

29.speaker: PENGUIN
29.japanese: 似たようなもんでしょ

32.speaker: PENGUIN
32.japanese: いい？　笹子さん　見てて…

33.speaker: SASAKO
33.japanese: 本当に　それ　便利なんですか？
33.english: Are you sure it's actually convenient? It's convenient, really!

34.speaker: PENGUIN
34.english: Let's see, it goes like this...

35.speaker: POLAR BEAR
35.japanese: そのうち　簡単に 操作できるようになるよ
35.english: It'll get easier to use over time. Oh, you have one, too, Polar Bear? Yup. Here, check it out.

37.speaker: PANDA
37.japanese: あぁ～　かっこいい！  (m´・ω・｀)m

38.speaker: SASAKO
38.japanese: シロクマさん　器用ですね
38.english: You're so talented, Mr. Polar Bear!

39.speaker: POLAR BEAR
39.japanese: それほどでも アヤメの花　折ってみた
39.english: It's nothing, really. I folded an iris.

42.speaker: PENGUIN
42.english: All right! Look at this! You go like this...

44.speaker: PENGUIN
44.english: It's no use. Don't worry. You just have to get used to it.

46.speaker: LLAMA
46.japanese: 僕も　スマフォですし
46.english: I have a sumafo, as well. Oh, really?

48.speaker: PENGUIN
48.japanese: ラマさん　そういう君こそ 上手に操作できるの？
48.english: I hear what you're saying, but are you sure you can actually use it, Mr. Llama?

49.speaker: LLAMA
49.japanese: もちろんですよ　見ててください
49.english: Of course. Just watch. Wow, that's amazing! Such flexible technique!

51.speaker: LLAMA
51.japanese: あっ　プロフ交換します？
51.english: Oh, do you want to exchange profiles?

53.speaker: POLAR BEAR
53.japanese: お勧めの便利なアプリ　知ってるよ
53.english: I know some really cool apps.

54.speaker: PENGUIN
54.japanese: え？ なになに？　教えて！

55.speaker: PANDA
55.japanese: やっぱ時代は　スマフォだよね
55.english: We're totally in the sumafo generation!

58.speaker: PANDA
58.japanese: スマフォがあると すっごく便利なんだから
58.english: It's really convenient to have a sumafo!

60.speaker: PANDA
60.japanese: 画面を ちまちま触って操作したり…
60.english: You can control the screen by poking it.

62.speaker: PANDA
62.japanese: くちばしで　つついたり…
62.english: You can poke it with your beak.

63.speaker: PANDA
63.japanese: そんでもって 字が　すっごく小さくて
63.english: And the words are really tiny and hard to read!

64.speaker: MAMA PANDA
64.english: Are you sure it's actually convenient?

66.speaker: PANDA
66.japanese: とにかく　外で働いてるパンダが ケータイ持ってないなんて
66.english: Anyway, a working panda like myself cannot possibly get by

68.speaker: MAMA PANDA
68.english: You'll get by just fine. You don't need one.

69.speaker: PANDA
69.english: I don't like that train of thought.

71.speaker: PANDA
71.japanese: ほら　ケータイあると 何かあったときに便利だよ
71.english: You see, if something happens, it'd be really convenient to have a cell phone.

73.speaker: MAMA PANDA
73.japanese: ねぇ　キッチンのバルサミコ酢が きれちゃったの
73.english: Hey, we're out of balsamic vinegar.

74.speaker: MAMA PANDA
74.japanese: バイト帰りに買ってきてくれる？
74.english: Could you get some on your way home from work?

77.speaker: MAMA PANDA
77.japanese: いいわよ　買ってあげる
77.english: All right, I'll buy you one.

80.speaker: SASAKO
80.english: What is it? I made the picture I took the other day my standby screen wallpaper. Are you not making anything with origami today?

81.speaker: POLAR BEAR
81.japanese: えっ？ 気が向いたら

85.speaker: SASAKO
85.japanese: パンダくん　嬉しそうだね

88.speaker: PANDA
88.japanese: パンダカバーのスマフォだよ！
88.english: It's a sumafo with a panda cover!

90.speaker: PANDA
90.japanese: いいでしょう～ 見つけるの苦労したんだよ
90.english: It is, isn't it? It was really hard to find.

93.speaker: PANDA
93.japanese: ほら　好きな時に　いつだって 天気予報も見られるしね
93.english: See? You can check the weather forecast whenever you want.

94.speaker: PANDA
94.japanese: 地図も見られるから 迷子にならなくて済むし
94.english: And you can look up maps so you don't get lost.

95.speaker: PANDA
95.japanese: 頭にのせて バランス感覚も　みがけるし
95.english: You can put it on your head and improve your balance, too!

96.speaker: PENGUIN
96.japanese: それ スマフォの使い方じゃないけどね
96.english: That's not proper sumafo usage, though.

97.speaker: LLAMA
97.japanese: でも　ペンギンさんより 使いこなしてませんか？
97.english: He seems to be using it better than you though, Mr. Penguin.

98.speaker: PENGUIN
98.japanese: ぼ　僕だって 待ち受けかえてるし
98.english: B-But I changed my standby screen!

101.speaker: PANDA
101.japanese: 音楽だって聴けるしね
101.english: And I can listen to music!

102.speaker: PENGUIN
102.japanese: だ　大丈夫だよ　パンダくん
102.english: I-It's okay, Panda! Looks like the only thing that broke was the cover.

104.speaker: SASAKO
104.japanese: だから　元気出して

105.speaker: LLAMA
105.japanese: スマフォが無事でよかったです
105.english: It's a good thing the sumafo is safe.

107.speaker: PANDA
107.japanese: 僕にとって…　スマフォは パンダカバーのおまけだから
107.english: But for me, the sumafo was an accessory to the panda cover.

108.speaker: MAMA PANDA
108.japanese: あら　ちょっと スマホは　どうしたの？　スマホは

111.speaker: MAMA PANDA
111.japanese: バ　ル　サ　ミ　コ　酢よ　バールーサーミーコー酢！
111.english: Bal-sa-mic vin-e-gar, got it? Bal-sam-ic vin-e-gar!

112.speaker: POLAR BEAR
112.japanese: この電話は　お客様の 都合により　出られません
112.english: We're sorry, your call cannot be completed at this time.

113.speaker: MAMA PANDA
113.japanese: ちっとも便利じゃないわね　スマホ
113.english: Sumahos aren't convenient at all, are they?

114.speaker: PANDA
114.japanese: あのさ　スマートフォンなんだから スマホじゃなくて　スマフォだよ
114.english: You know, it's called a "smartphone," so it's "sumafo," not "sumaho."

115.speaker: MAMA PANDA
115.japanese: どっちだっていいじゃない

116.speaker: PANDA
116.english: Hello! Could I get my usual, Polar Bear?

117.speaker: PENGUIN
117.japanese: パンダくん　ひょっとして 立ち直った？

119.speaker: PENGUIN
119.japanese: 心配した僕が　バカだったよ
119.english: Apparently I was an idiot for worrying. Your sumafo is right here, Panda. Oh. I don't need the sumafo anymore. Are you just trying to act tough?

120.speaker: PANDA
120.japanese: 本気　だって　パンダじゃないし
120.english: No, I'm serious. It's not even a panda.

121.speaker: SASAKO
121.japanese: えっ？　せっかく買ったんだから 大事に使ったら？
121.english: What?  You just bought it, you should use it.

122.speaker: POLAR BEAR
122.japanese: パンダくん　これ見て　スマフォのケース

123.speaker: POLAR BEAR
123.english: I tried folding something like this.

125.speaker: PENGUIN
125.japanese: これなら　紙だから割れないね
125.english: This time, it's made out of paper so it won't break.

127.speaker: SASAKO
127.japanese: シロクマさん　さすが！

128.speaker: PANDA
128.japanese: フフッ　やっぱり　パンダは最高だね

129.speaker: PANDA
129.japanese: どうしたの　ペンギンさん　食あたり？
129.english: What's wrong, Mr. Penguin? Did you get food poisoning?

131.speaker: LLAMA
131.japanese: ペン子さんのことですよね
131.english: It's about Miss Penko, isn't it? N-No, it's not! I'm going to a driver's training school. He's trying to get his driver's license.

133.speaker: POLAR BEAR
133.japanese: ペン子さんをドライブに誘いたいみたい
133.english: He wants to ask Miss Penko out for a drive.

134.speaker: PENGUIN
134.english: H-How do you know that?! You wrote about it on your blog.

135.speaker: PENGUIN
135.japanese: あ～　ペン子さん　ペン子さん あなたと行きたい海辺のドライブ
135.english: Oh, Miss Penko, Miss Penko, I want to take you on a drive by the ocean.

136.speaker: PENGUIN
136.japanese: 僕は通うよ　教習所
136.english: Thus I am going to driving school.

137.speaker: PENGUIN
137.japanese: 人の日記勝手に読まないでよ！(#`O′)
137.english: Don't read people's diaries without permission!

138.speaker: POLAR BEAR
138.japanese: いや　ブログってそういうものだし
138.english: Well, blogs are meant for others to read.

139.speaker: LLAMA
139.japanese: 読まれたくないなら 非公開にした方がいいですよ
139.english: If you don't want others to read it, you should make your blog private.

140.speaker: SASAKO
140.japanese: 教習所　大変なんですか？

142.speaker: PANDA
142.japanese: 車の運転って　そんなに難しいの？
142.english: Is driving a car that hard?

143.speaker: PENGUIN
143.japanese: まあね 教えてくれる教官は厳しいし
143.english: Yeah. The instructor is really mean

144.japanese: 今日も縦列駐車ができなくってさ
144.english: and I wasn't able to parallel park today.

145.speaker: POLAR BEAR
145.japanese: 最初は難しいよね　縦列駐車
145.english: Parallel parking is always hard at first.

148.speaker: PANDA
148.english: Ten cars in a row {\i1}(jyuretsu chusha){\i0}?

149.speaker: PANDA
149.english: Ten shots in a row {\i1}(jyuretsu chusha){\i0}?

150.speaker: PANDA
150.english: Ten headbands in a row {\i1}(jyuretsu kachusha){\i0}?

151.speaker: PANDA
151.english: Ten kisses in a row {\i1}(jyuretsu chuu){\i0}?

152.speaker: PENGUIN
152.japanese: じゃあ　明日１１時に集合ね

153.speaker: PENGUIN
153.japanese: もう　聞いてなかったの？
153.english: Jeez, weren't you listening at all?

156.speaker: LLAMA
156.japanese: シロクマさんに　ペンギンさんが運転の コツを教えてもらうんですよ
156.english: Mr. Polar Bear is going to show Mr. Penguin the techniques of driving.

157.speaker: PENGUIN
157.japanese: パンダくん　どうせ暇でしょ？
157.english: You don't have anything better to do anyways, do you, Panda?

158.speaker: PANDA
158.japanese: ゴロゴロするのに忙しいよ(*￣∇￣)ノ

159.speaker: PENGUIN
159.japanese: それって暇じゃないの？ まあいいや
159.english: That would mean you have time. Oh, whatever.

160.speaker: PENGUIN
160.japanese: じゃあ　やめとく？　ドライブ
160.english: Then do you not want to come driving? Oh, we're going on a drive? Of course I'll come!

161.speaker: PENGUIN
161.japanese: もう　じゃあ明日　カフェの前ね
161.english: Jeez. Then we'll meet tomorrow right outside the café. Okay!

162.speaker: PENGUIN
162.japanese: パンダくん　まだかな？
162.english: I wonder what's taking Panda so long.

166.speaker: PENGUIN
166.japanese: 遅いよ　パンダくん
166.english: You're late, Panda. What's with the bamboo?!

167.speaker: PANDA
167.japanese: ドライブに　おやつは必要だよ
167.english: You always need snacks when you go for a drive.

168.speaker: PANDA
168.japanese: みんなの分も持ってきたからね

169.speaker: PENGUIN
169.japanese: いや　いらないから

170.japanese: それ　パンダくんだけのおやつだし
170.english: Not to mention that snack is only for you, Panda.

174.speaker: PENGUIN
174.japanese: いいから出発しようよ
174.english: Come on, let's get going already.

175.speaker: PANDA
175.english: Where's Mr. Llama? He had to work at the zoo today.

176.speaker: PENGUIN
176.japanese: じゃあ　シロクマくん　頼むね
176.english: All right, let's get going then, Polar Bear.

177.speaker: PANDA
177.japanese: 後部座席って微妙だよね
177.english: The backseats in cars are always questionable.

178.speaker: PANDA
178.japanese: 寝っ転がるには狭いしさ
178.english: They're never big enough to sleep comfortably on.

179.speaker: PENGUIN
179.japanese: パンダくん　ちゃんと座って
179.english: Sit up straight back there, Panda.

180.speaker: POLAR BEAR
180.english: Okay, here we go. Amazing. You handled starting the car like a pro.

182.speaker: PENGUIN
182.japanese: ねぇ　コツは？　コツ

183.speaker: POLAR BEAR
183.japanese: そうだね　グッときたらピッとして ゴー！
183.english: Well, let's see... Once you feel like this, you do this, and go!

185.speaker: PENGUIN
185.japanese: 抽象的だな　よくわかんないよ(o´∀｀o)
185.english: That's a little too abstract. I don't understand any of it.

187.speaker: PANDA
187.japanese: つるしたタイヤに ジャレるみたいな感じだよ　たぶん
187.english: It's probably something like when you're swinging from a tire swing.

188.speaker: PENGUIN
188.japanese: ますます　わかんないから
188.english: You're making it even more confusing!

191.japanese: 笹が　いっぱい生えてそうな
191.english: Especially one where there's plenty of bamboo grass. Somewhere around here is just fine. The whole point of this trip is so I can learn Polar Bear's driving techniques.

192.speaker: PENGUIN
192.japanese: シロクマくん　免許はいつ取ったの？
192.english: When did you get your license, Polar Bear?

194.speaker: PENGUIN
194.japanese: いや　そうじゃなくてさ
194.english: That's not exactly what I meant...

198.speaker: MAN
198.japanese: こんにちは　パンダくん

199.speaker: MAN
199.english: Are you going on a trip?

202.speaker: PANDA
202.japanese: あ～あ なんか　お腹減っちゃったね

203.speaker: PENGUIN
203.japanese: 今　笹食べてたじゃない
203.english: You were just eating bamboo grass! Let's go there!

204.speaker: WORKER
204.japanese: いらっしゃいませ ご注文は　お決まりですか？
204.english: Welcome, are you ready to order?

205.speaker: PANDA
205.english: Could I get bamboo or bamboo grass, please?

206.speaker: WORKER
206.japanese: 申し訳ありません 当店のメニューにはございません
206.english: I'm terribly sorry, that is not on our menu.

207.speaker: POLAR BEAR
207.english: We'll come back. Welcome, are you ready to order?

208.speaker: PENGUIN
208.japanese: フィッシュバーガー　フィッシュ　生で
208.english: Can I get a fish burger? But I want the fish raw!

209.speaker: WORKER
209.japanese: 申し訳ありません 当店のメニューにはございません
209.english: I'm terribly sorry, that is not on our menu.

211.speaker: WORKER
211.japanese: いらっしゃいませ ご注文は　お決まりですか？
211.english: Welcome, are you ready to order?

212.speaker: POLAR BEAR
212.japanese: いいボケが思いつかないので
212.english: I couldn't think of a good joke,

216.speaker: PENGUIN
216.japanese: だから フィッシュバーガーセットでいいじゃない
216.english: That's why I'm telling you to get the fish burger meal!

217.speaker: PANDA
217.japanese: レタスバーガーセットがいいよ
217.english: The lettuce burger meal is better.

218.japanese: 笹じゃないけど葉っぱだし
218.english: It's not bamboo grass, but it is a leaf.

219.speaker: POLAR BEAR
219.japanese: てりやきバーガーセットがいいよ
219.english: The teriyaki burger meal is better.

223.speaker: WORKER
223.japanese: あの　グルグル回らず そこで相談なさって かまいませんから！
223.english: Um, you don't need to drive in circles! You can stay there until you decide!

224.speaker: WORKER
224.japanese: ご注文を　うけたまわりました

225.japanese: 受け渡し窓口まで お進みになって　お待ちください
225.english: Please go to the next window to pick it up.

228.speaker: WORKER
228.japanese: ドライブスルーで遊ばないでくださいw(ﾟДﾟ)w
228.english: Please don't play in the drive-thru!

229.speaker: PANDA
229.japanese: どう？　ペンギンさん　コツは　つかめた？
229.english: What do you think, Mr. Penguin? Did you think you get the technique down?

231.speaker: POLAR BEAR
231.japanese: ドライブスルーで遊ぶコツ？
231.english: The technique for playing in a drive-thru?

232.speaker: PENGUIN
232.japanese: 僕は　運転のコツを つかみたいんだけどな～
232.english: I would like to learn the techniques of driving.

233.speaker: PANDA
233.japanese: ねえ　シロクマくん あれは　やらないの？
233.english: Hey, Polar Bear, aren't you going to do that thing?

235.speaker: PANDA
235.japanese: ほら　わらしべ長者
235.english: You know, Lord Straw Stalk {\i1}(Warashibe Chouja){\i0}.

238.speaker: PENGUIN
238.english: Those are two completely different things.

239.speaker: POLAR BEAR
239.japanese: ペンギンさん　よくわかったね
239.english: Good job on figuring that out, Mr. Penguin. Come on, Polar Bear, you should try it!

240.speaker: PENGUIN
240.japanese: ちゃんと運転のコツ教えてよ
240.english: Show me a driving technique! Okay.

241.speaker: POLAR BEAR
241.japanese: よし　ここにしよう

242.speaker: POLAR BEAR
242.japanese: じゃあ　よく見ててね

243.speaker: POLAR BEAR
243.japanese: 周りをよく見て　バックする
243.english: Look carefully at your surroundings, and then back up.

244.speaker: PENGUIN
244.japanese: よく見て　バックね
244.english: So look carefully and then back up.

247.speaker: POLAR BEAR
247.japanese: こうやって　上からだと見やすい
247.english: ...it's really easy to see when you stick your head out up here.

248.speaker: PENGUIN
248.japanese: 真似できないから！　もう…╮(￣▽￣")╭
248.english: I can't do that, though! Jeez.

250.speaker: PENGUIN
250.english: Is everything okay? Did you hit something?

252.speaker: SASAKO
252.japanese: あっ　シロクマさん

253.speaker: SASAKO
253.japanese: 今日は皆さんでドライブですか？ どちらまで？
253.english: Are you all going for a drive today? Where are you all headed?

255.speaker: POLAR BEAR
255.english: Where are you headed, Miss Sasako?

257.speaker: SASAKO
257.english: Oh, I know. Here, I'll share these with you.

259.speaker: SASAKO
259.japanese: この先に　おいしいお店があるって 聞いて　買いに行ったんです
259.english: I heard that a really good place opened up, so I went to get some. Thank you! I was just getting hungry.

262.speaker: PANDA
262.japanese: 大丈夫です…　笹は別腹ですから
262.english: Oh, I'm fine. There's always room for bamboo grass.

263.speaker: POLAR BEAR
263.japanese: パンダくん　夢のなかでも まだ食べてるみたいだね
263.english: It looks like Panda's still eating, even in his dreams.

265.japanese: 助手席で寝るなんて失礼なこと 僕は　しないよ！
265.english: I-I would never be so rude as to fall asleep in the passenger seat! If you don't speak up, I can't tell if you asleep or awake, Mr. Penguin.

266.speaker: PENGUIN
266.japanese: 起きてる！　ほんと　信じて！

267.speaker: POLAR BEAR
267.japanese: いや　寝てても　かまわないけど
267.english: Well, I wouldn't care if you were asleep. Don't make me sound like Panda!

268.speaker: PENGUIN
268.japanese: 僕は運転のコツを学ぶんだから
268.english: I'm going to learn the techniques of driving!

269.speaker: POLAR BEAR
269.japanese: 免許取ったら　車買うの？
269.english: Are you going to buy a car once you get your license? I'm not sure.

270.japanese: この車みたいなミニバンもいいよね～
270.english: Mini-vans like this are good, too.

271.speaker: PENGUIN
271.japanese: ああいうのも　かっこいいな～

272.speaker: PENGUIN
272.japanese: ペン子さん 君に見せたいものがあるんだ
272.english: There's something I want to show you, Miss Penko.

273.speaker: PENKO
273.english: Oh, I wonder what it could be? Look, over there. What's that?

282.speaker: POLAR BEAR
282.english: A saber {\i1}(sa-beru){\i0}. Yodel {\i1}(yo-deru){\i0}. It's a little lonely when there's no one to retort.

291.speaker: PENGUIN
291.japanese: 何言ってるの？　よくないでしょ
291.english: What are you talking about? That's not good at all. What are we going to do, Mr. Penguin?

292.speaker: PENGUIN
292.japanese: そうだなぁ 車屋さん呼べばいいのかなぁ
292.english: I'm not sure. Maybe we should call a car dealership?

293.speaker: POLAR BEAR
293.japanese: 慌てない　慌てない

295.speaker: POLAR BEAR
295.japanese: 引いて帰ればいいから
295.english: I can just pull it back home.

297.speaker: POLAR BEAR
297.japanese: コツは　バンパーにツメを引っ掛ける
297.english: The trick is to wrap your nails around the bumper.

298.speaker: PANDA
298.japanese: いろいろ 教えてもらえてよかったね
298.english: It's a good thing he's teaching you all this.

299.speaker: PENGUIN
299.japanese: 絶対　真似はできないけどね
299.english: I'm definitely not going to be able to repeat this.

300.speaker: PENGUIN
300.japanese: まぁ　でも　おもしろいから 写真撮っておこう(＾－＾)V
300.english: Well, you know... This is amusing, so I'm going to take a picture anyway.

301.speaker: PANDA
301.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん　何か面白い話して
301.english: Mr. Penguin, Mr. Penguin, tell me a funny story.

303.japanese: 絵に書いたようなむちゃぶりだね
303.english: That's a textbook way to put me on the spot.

304.speaker: PANDA
304.japanese: じゃ～今日からペンギンさんのこと　忠実な下部と考えていい
304.english: Then can I think of you as my loyal servant as of today?

306.speaker: PANDA
306.english: Mr. Penguin, you're the textbook definition of stingy.

308.speaker: POLAR BEAR
308.japanese: さ～て　来週のしろくまカフェは
308.english: Well then, next week on Polar Bear's Café,

310.speaker: PENGUIN
310.japanese: ちょっと　やめて　そういうの
310.english: Hey! Would you cut that out?
